item.name: PowerDNS: Recieved corrupt packets
item.description: Number of corrupt packets received per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Deferred cache inserts
item.description: Number of cache inserts that were deferred because of maintenance per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Deferred cache lookups
item.description: Number of cache lookups that were deferred because of maintenance per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Deferred packet cache inserts
item.description: Number of packet cache inserts that were deferred because of maintenance per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Deferred packet cache loopkups
item.description: Number of packet cache lookups that were deferred because of maintenance per second

item.name: PowerDNS: DNS updates answered
item.description: Number of DNS update packets successfully answered per second

item.name: PowerDNS: DNS updates changes
item.description: Total number of changes to records from DNS update per second

item.name: PowerDNS: DNS updates queries recieved
item.description: Number of DNS update packets received per second

item.name: PowerDNS: DNS updates queries refused
item.description: Number of DNS update packets that were refused per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Cached negative queries
item.description: Number of cached negative queries

item.name: PowerDNS: Cached queries
item.description: Number of cached queries

item.name: PowerDNS: Incoming notofications
item.description: Number of NOTIFY packets that were received per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Key cache size
item.description: Number of entries in the key cache

item.name: PowerDNS:Latency
item.description: Average number of microseconds a packet spends within PowerDNS

item.name: PowerDNS: Metadata cache size
item.description: Number of entries in the metadata cache

item.name: PowerDNS: Open TCP connections
item.description: Number of currently open TCP connections

item.name: PowerDNS: Dropped packets
item.description: Number of questions dropped because backends overloaded

item.name: PowerDNS: Packetcache hits
item.description: Number of packets which were answered out of the cache per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Packetcache misses
item.description: Number of times a packet could not be answered out of the cache per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Packetcache cache size
item.description: Amount of packets in the packetcache

item.name: PowerDNS: Pdns service ping
item.description: Status for the pdns service via "pdns_control ping"

trigger.name: PowerDNS: PowerDNS service is not responding

item.name: PowerDNS: Database queue size
item.description: Number of packets waiting for database attention

item.name: PowerDNS: Query cache hits
item.description: Number of hits on the Query Cache per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Query cache misses
item.description: Number of misses on the Query Cache per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Query cache size
item.description: Number of entries in the query cache

item.name: PowerDNS: Packets requesting recursion
item.description: Number of packets sent by clients requesting recursion per second (regardless of if weâ€™ll be providing them with recursion).

item.name: PowerDNS: Recursing queries answered
item.description: Number of packets we supplied an answer to after recursive processing per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Recursing queries processed
item.description: Number of packets we performed recursive processing for per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Recursing queries where recursor timed out
item.description: Number of packets we sent to our recursor, but did not get a timely answer for per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Security status
item.description: Security status based on Security Polling. Checks if the current version is considered secure by PowerDNS and returns wether updating is recommended (2) or required (3). If Error (0) is recieved the server was not able to resolve the security status for some reason.

trigger.name: PowerDNS: The current version of PowerDNS is no longer considered secure
trigger.description: The current version of PowerDNS is not considered secure, an upgrade is required.

item.name: PowerDNS: Returned servfail
item.description: Amount of packets that could not be answered due to database problems per second

item.name: PowerDNS: DNSSEC signature cache size
item.description: Number of entries in the signature cache

item.name: PowerDNS: Number of DNSSEC signatures
item.description: Number of DNSSEC signatures created

item.name: PowerDNS: Used CPU time in ms (system)
item.description: Number of CPU milliseconds sent in system time

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over TCP
item.description: Number of answers sent out over TCP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over TCP
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over TCP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over TCP
item.description: Number of questions received over TCP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over TCPv4
item.description: Number of answers sent out over TCPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over TCPv4
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over TCPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over TCPv4
item.description: Number of questions received over TCPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over TCPv6
item.description: Number of answers sent out over TCPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over TCPv6
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over TCPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over TCPv6
item.description: Number of questions received over TCPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Packets dropped due to internal timeout
item.description: Amount of packets that were dropped because they had to wait too long internally per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over UDP
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over UDP
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over UDP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries with DNSSEC OK bit set
item.description: Number of queries received with the DO (DNSSEC OK) bit set per second

item.name: PowerDNS: UDP packets not processed by OS
item.description: Number of packets, received faster than the OS could process them

item.name: PowerDNS: UDP packets with recieved ICMP no listening port
item.description: Number of UDP packets where an ICMP response was received that the remote port was not listening per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over UDP
item.description: Number of questions received over UDP per second

item.name: PowerDNS: UDP recieve buffer errors
item.description: Number of errors caused in the UDP receive buffer per second

item.name: PowerDNS: UDP send buffer errors
item.description: Number of errors caused in the UDP send buffer per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over UDPv4
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over UDPv4
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over UDPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over UDPv4
item.description: Number of questions received over UDPv4 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Answers sent over UDPv6
item.description: Number of answers sent out over UDPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Bytes sent over UDPv6
item.description: Total number of answer bytes sent over UDPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: Queries received over UDPv6
item.description: Number of questions received over UDPv6 per second

item.name: PowerDNS: PowerDNS deamon uptime
item.description: Uptime in seconds of the daemon

trigger.name: PowerDNS: The PowerDNS deamon was restarted

item.name: PowerDNS: Used CPU time in ms (user)
item.description: Number of milliseconds spend in CPU â€˜userâ€™ time

item.name: PowerDNS: Version
item.description: Version of the pdns deamon

trigger.expression: {Template App PowerDNS:pdns.overload-drops.min(3m)}<>0 or {Template App PowerDNS:pdns.servfail-packets.min(3m)}<>0 or {Template App PowerDNS:pdns.timedout-packets.min(3m)}<>0
trigger.name: PowerDNS: Queries not resolving due to internal error
trigger.description: DNS queries are not answered due to dropped packets or internal server errors
